parts.content: For the circuit shown, calculate  V<sub>1</sub>,  V<sub>3</sub>, and  V<sub>5</sub> when V<sub>s</sub> = 7 V, R<sub>1</sub> = 18 Ω, R<sub>2</sub> = 66 Ω, R<sub>3</sub> = 57 Ω, R<sub>4</sub> = 37 Ω, and R<sub>5</sub> = 33 Ω.
parts.need: Express your answer to two significant figures, with appropriate units.

problems.title: Problem 5
problems.content: Consider two voltage dividers shown in (Figure 1). Suppose that

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: The voltage divider in part (a) in (Figure 1) is loaded with the voltage divider shown in part (b) in (Figure 1); that is, a is connected to a′, and b is connected to b′. Find v<sub>o</sub>.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Now assume the voltage divider in figure (b) is connected to the voltage divider in figure (a) by means of a current-controlled voltage source as shown in (Figure 2). Find v<sub>o</sub>.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: What effect does adding the dependent-voltage source have on the operation of the voltage divider that is connected to the 160 V source?
parts.need: Drag the appropriate term on the left to the blank on the right to complete the sentence.
parts.answer: The current through the 75 kΩ resistor in the circuit with the dependent-voltage source the current through the resistor in the circuit without the dependent-voltage source. The voltage on the 75 kΩ resistor in the divider connected to the 160 V source is equal to the open-circuit voltage of the divider. The dependent-voltage source removes the loading effect of the second voltage divider on the first voltage divider.

problems.title: Problem 6
problems.content: Consider the circuit shown in (Figure 1). Suppose that

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Use current division to find the current in R<sub>1</sub> from left to right.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Use the result from the previous part and current division to find the current in R<sub>6</sub> from top to bottom.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

problems.title: Problem 7
problems.content: Attach a <input id='p7-V' type='number'> V voltage source between the terminals a-b in (Figure 1), with the positive terminal at the top.

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Use voltage division to find the voltage across the 4 Ω resistor, positive at the left.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part B
parts.content: Use the result from part A to find the current in the 4 Ω resistor from left to right.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part C
parts.content: Use the result from part B and current division to find the current in the 16 Ω resistor from left to right.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part D
parts.content: Use the result from part C and current division to find the current in the 10 Ω resistor from top to bottom.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part E
parts.content: Use the result from part D to find the voltage across the 10 Ω resistor, positive at the top.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

parts.title: Part F
parts.content: Use the result from part E and voltage division to find the voltage across the 18 Ω resistor, positive at the top.
parts.need: Express your answer to three significant figures and include the appropriate units.

problems.title: Problem 12
problems.content: Consider the circuit shown in (Figure 1). Suppose that

parts.title: Part A
parts.content: Simplify the circuit in (Figure 1) by using a Y-to-Δ transformation involving resistors 2, 3, and 5 as shown in (Figure 2). Determine the resistances of the equivalent Δ.

parts.content: Determine the equivalent resistance R<sub>ab</sub> in the circuit.

parts.title: Part D

parts.title: Part E
parts.content: Give two additional Δ-to-Y or Y-to-Δ transformations that could be used to find R<sub>ab<sub>.
